result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandi Michelle Hauptli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with work release and transfer privileges

9:10 - Defendant, Brandi Michelle Hauptli in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Beaver Dam Shopko.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.
